datasetStructure: One record per microbiology specimen finding per time point per visit per subject

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: MBSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain to support relationships within the domain and between domains. In MB, used to link to findings about organisms which are stored in MS.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: MBGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBREFID

datasetVariables.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: Specimen ID
datasetVariables.label: Reference ID
datasetVariables.name: MBREFID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: ORGANISM IDENTIFIER. For organism identification, MBSPID would remain the same each time the same organism is identified in a new specimen.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: MBSPID

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Microbiology Test or Finding Short Name

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBTESTCD

self.title: Microbiology Test or Finding Short Name

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or finding described in MBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). MBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples for GRAM STAIN findings: GMNROD, GMNCOC, GMSQEPCE, GMPMNLOW. Examples for CULTURE PLATE findings: ORGANISM.
datasetVariables.label: Microbiology Test or Finding Short Name
datasetVariables.name: MBTESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBTEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in MBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: GRAM NEGATIVE RODS, GRAM NEGATIVE COCCI, SQUAMOUS EPITHELIAL CELLS, PMN PER FIELD LOW, ORGANISM PRESENT
datasetVariables.label: Microbiology Test or Finding Name
datasetVariables.name: MBTEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of related records.
datasetVariables.label: Category for Microbiology Finding
datasetVariables.name: MBCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBSCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a further categorization of MBCAT.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Microbiology Finding
datasetVariables.name: MBSCAT

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBORRES

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariables.description: Result of the Microbiology measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples for GRAM STAIN findings: +3 MODERATE, +2 FEW, <10. Examples for CULTURE PLATE (ORGANISM) findings: KLEBSIELLA PNEUMONIAE, STREPTOCOCCUS PNEUMONIAE.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariables.name: MBORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBORRESU

datasetVariables.description: Original unit for MBORRES. Example: mcg/mL
datasetVariables.label: Original Units
datasetVariables.name: MBORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MBORRES in a standard format or standard units. MBSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MBSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "+3 MODERATE", "MOD", and "MODERATE" in MBORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MBSTRESC as "MODERATE".
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: MBSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MBSTRESC. MBSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: MBSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for MBSTRESC and MBSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: MBSTRESU

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBRESCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding in a standard format. Example for ORGANISM finding: INFECTING, COLONIZER, CONTAMINANT, or NORMAL FLORA.
datasetVariables.label: Result Category
datasetVariables.name: MBRESCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate Microbiology was not done, or a test was not done. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: MBSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBREASND

datasetVariables.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MBSTAT when value is NOT DONE. Examples: BROKEN EQUIPMENT or SUBJECT REFUSED.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Microbiology Not Performed
datasetVariables.name: MBREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

datasetVariables.name: MBLOINC

datasetVariables.name: MBMETHOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: MBBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null. Records that represent the average of other records or some other derivation, and those that do not come from the CRF, are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If MBDRVFL=Y, then MBORRES may be null with MBSTRESC and (if numeric) MBSTRESN having the derived value.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: MBDRVFL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: 1. Clinical encounter number. 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBDTC

priorVersion.title: Study Day of MB Specimen Collection

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBDY

self.title: Study Day of MB Specimen Collection

datasetVariables.description: 1. Study day of the specimen collection, measured as integer days. 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of MB Specimen Collection
datasetVariables.name: MBDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBTPT

datasetVariables.description: 1. Text Description of time when specimen should be taken. 2. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See MBTPTNUM and MBTPTREF. Examples: Start, 5 min post.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: MBTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBTPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of MBTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: MBTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (MBTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by MBTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by MBTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: MBELTM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by MBELTM, MBTPTNUM, and MBTPT. Example: PREVIOUS DOSE.
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: MBTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MB.MBRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of the reference time point, MBTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: MBRFTDTC

description: A findings domain that represents non-host organisms identified including bacteria, viruses, parasites, protozoa and fungi. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49602, 2018-06-29)
label: Microbiology Specimen
name: MB
